page.title: 02The Great Orme-Landscape (1)
page.content: The{Great Orme}is a carboniferous limestone headland, 207 metres above sea level, and is surrounded on three sides by sea.The main features are : {cliffs, limestone grassland, {heathland, limestone pavement and {farming. }These different habitats give us 350 species of wild plants. {The Great Orme Country Park and Nature {Reserve}(area 3sq.km.) was set up in 1980, under the care of Mr.John Davies (Warden), to maintain and preserve the rich variety of natural life on The Orme. The Orme has become a recreational attraction having a footpath, road, tramway and cable car to the summit. The summit has a cafe and hotel,a shop and a bar, and is visited annually by half a million people.The cliffs are popular with climbers and hang-glider enthusiasts.
